messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] relaxing
messages.msgSnippet: Reminds me of the diaper ad -- how the Mom buys the expensive name-brand for baby #1 and then gets real with baby #2 and realizes the cheaper brand works just
messages.messageBody:
Reminds me of the diaper ad -- how the Mom buys the expensive name-brand for
baby #1 and then gets real with baby #2 and realizes the cheaper brand works
just as well.

Maybe this relaxing process is natural for a lot of parents -- or maybe it's
just too tiring to be so perfect after you go past baby #1. :)

Nance


In a message dated 12/8/2003 11:22:29 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
little children who are trying so hard to teach them
and train them and I smile remembering I was like that
too, and hopefully I can talk to them and reassure
them that they can relax and enjoy them. Sometimes
just pointing out how funny they are being right then
is all that parent needs. You can see the tension
ease away.

Susan
wifetovegman


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
